ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin deceptivus, from Latin decipere ('to deceive'). Equivalent to deceive + -ive.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: describes a noun or pronoun
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Giving an appearance or impression different from the true one; misleading.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 给人以不同于真实情况的表象或印象；误导性的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The calm appearance of the sea can be deceptive.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 大海平静的外表可能具有欺骗性。
